texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Buildah and podman make a great pair for building, managing and running containers on a Linux system. You can even  use them with GitLab CI  with a few small adjustments, namely the switch from the overlayfs to vfs storage driver.
texts.text: Buildah and podman make a great pair for building, managing and running containers on a Linux system. You can even  use them with GitLab CI  with a few small adjustments, namely the switch from the overlayfs to vfs storage driver.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I have some regularly scheduled GitLab CI jobs that attempt to build fresh containers each morning and I use these to get the latest packages and find out early when something is broken in the build process. A failed build appeared in my inbox earlier this week with the following error:
texts.text: I have some regularly scheduled GitLab CI jobs that attempt to build fresh containers each morning and I use these to get the latest packages and find out early when something is broken in the build process. A failed build appeared in my inbox earlier this week with the following error:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
+ buildah bud -f builds/builder-fedora30 -t builder-fedora30 .
vfs driver does not support overlay.mountopt options
texts.text:
+ buildah bud -f builds/builder-fedora30 -t builder-fedora30 .
vfs driver does not support overlay.mountopt options

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My container build script[^1] is fairly basic, but it does include a change to use the vfs storage driver:
texts.text: My container build script[^1] is fairly basic, but it does include a change to use the vfs storage driver:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Use vfs with buildah. Docker offers overlayfs as a default, but buildah
# cannot stack overlayfs on top of another overlayfs filesystem.
export STORAGE_DRIVER=vfs
texts.text:
# Use vfs with buildah. Docker offers overlayfs as a default, but buildah
# cannot stack overlayfs on top of another overlayfs filesystem.
export STORAGE_DRIVER=vfs

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The script doesn't change any mount options during the build process. A quick glance at the
texts.text: The script doesn't change any mount options during the build process. A quick glance at the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /etc/containers/storage.conf
texts.text: /etc/containers/storage.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: revealed a possible problem:
texts.text: revealed a possible problem:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
[storage.options]
# Storage options to be passed to underlying storage drivers

# mountopt specifies comma separated list of extra mount options
mountopt = "nodev,metacopy=on"
texts.text:
[storage.options]
# Storage options to be passed to underlying storage drivers

# mountopt specifies comma separated list of extra mount options
mountopt = "nodev,metacopy=on"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: These mount options make sense when used with an overlayfs filesystem, but they are not used with vfs. I commented out the
texts.text: These mount options make sense when used with an overlayfs filesystem, but they are not used with vfs. I commented out the

texts.orig: mountopt

texts.orig: Fixing the build script involved a small change to the
texts.text: Fixing the build script involved a small change to the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: storage.conf
texts.text: storage.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: just before building the container:
texts.text: just before building the container:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Use vfs with buildah. Docker offers overlayfs as a default, but buildah
# cannot stack overlayfs on top of another overlayfs filesystem.
export STORAGE_DRIVER=vfs

# Newer versions of podman/buildah try to set overlayfs mount options when
# using the vfs driver, and this causes errors.
sed -i '/^mountopt =.*/d' /etc/containers/storage.conf
texts.text:
# Use vfs with buildah. Docker offers overlayfs as a default, but buildah
# cannot stack overlayfs on top of another overlayfs filesystem.
export STORAGE_DRIVER=vfs

# Newer versions of podman/buildah try to set overlayfs mount options when
# using the vfs driver, and this causes errors.
sed -i '/^mountopt =.*/d' /etc/containers/storage.conf

texts.label: paragraph
